comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: Aviator, balloonist, and aeronautical engineer Ralph Hazlett Upson (b. 1888 - d. 1968). His career spanned from flying in balloon races, including winning the Gordon Bennett Cup (with R.A.D. Preston as his co-pilot) in the 1913 International Balloon Races, as well as winning the 1913, 1919, and 1921 National Balloon Races, to working on the still-born X-20 Dyna-Soar orbital space glider program in the 1960s. See: www.nasm.si.edu/research/arch/findaids/upson/rhu_sec_3.html

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: TVL 1970: Thanks for pointing us to more information about Upson.  We'll include some next time we update.
